<center>![Break](http://dev.bukkit.org/media/images/59/204/Line_Break_PNG.png)</center>

EchoPet is a simple Donator Perk plugin by DSH105, designed to add Pets that follow players around on their adventures throughout Minecraft. All Pets are custom entities, designed carefully and controlled by the plugin.

<center>![Break](http://dev.bukkit.org/media/images/59/204/Line_Break_PNG.png)</center>

<center>![Features](http://dev.bukkit.org/media/images/59/383/Features_PNG.png)</center>

* Great for donator perks!
* Pets are greatly customisable, through the extensive CommandBase and PetMenu
* A Custom AI makes all Pets focused on specific goals, handled closely by the core of the Plugin
* All mobs can be Pets (Except Enderdragons and Giants)
* All events fired by the plugin are accessible through the **EchoPet Developer API**
* The API also makes it possible to add many new and interesting features to the limit of creativity

<center>![Break](http://dev.bukkit.org/media/images/59/204/Line_Break_PNG.png)</center>

<center>![MCStats](http://dev.bukkit.org/media/images/59/380/MCStats_PNG.png)</center>

EchoPet is in the top 150 plugins, as tracked by MCStats. It's usage has been tracked across over 600 individual servers, and it's all thanks to you!

<center>![MCStats](http://api.mcstats.org/signature/EchoPet.png)</center>

<center>![Break](http://dev.bukkit.org/media/images/59/204/Line_Break_PNG.png)</center>

<center>![Auto-Update](http://dev.bukkit.org/media/images/59/385/Auto-Update_PNG.png)</center>

EchoPet comes with an [auto-updater](http://forums.bukkit.org/threads/updater-easy-safe-and-policy-compliant-auto-updating-for-your-plugins.96681/) to save you, as a server owner, from continually checking this page for new files. It simply connects to dev.bukkit.org and compares the versions of available files. If you **do not** wish for EchoPet to perform this check, navigate to the Configuration File (config.yml) in the EchoPet directory of your plugins folder and change "checkForUpdates" and "autoUpdate" to "false". The first value disables the version comparison altogether and the second updates the plugin automatically if new files are detected.
